_description: The Wright’s Chaste Wife — 672 lines in 6-line stanzas

Lam306.First Lines:
[A]llmyghty god maker of allSaue you my souereyns in bowre
                    shall…
Lam306.Last Lines:
…The loue of god and of the comenysSubdies bene of
                    ryghtExplicit
Lam306.Attributed Title:
A ffable of a Wryght that was maryde to a pore / wydows dowter the whiche
                        wydow havyng noo good to geve with / her gave as for a precyous
                    Iohell to hym a Rose garlond / the whyche sche / affermyd wold never fade while
                    sche kept / truly her wedlok (f. 178, in a later hand)
Lam306.Editions:
Furnivall,  Frederick James,
                        ed.  
             Adam of Cobsam: The Wright’s Chaste Wife.
EETS
         o.s. 12 (1865); 2nd revised ed.,1869; 3rd ed. 1891; repr.
            1965.
